articleContent.title: Chord: 9th in A# (Shape: D)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 9th in A# (Shape: D)

## Brief Presentation
The 9th chord in A# using the D chord shape is a rich and complex sounding chord that can add color and depth to music. It is formed by combining the A# note with the 9th note in the A# major scale and is played in the D shape on the guitar.

## Notes and Intervals
- A# (Root)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- F## (Perfect 5th)
- A# (Octave)
- C## (Major 7th)
- B# (Major 9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This chord is often used in jazz, R&B, and soul music to add sophistication and a jazzy flavor to chord progressions. The major 9th chord in A# has a lush and dreamy quality, providing a sense of tension and release that can evoke emotions and create a sense of movement in the music.

## Songs
1. "My Funny Valentine" by Chet Baker - This classic jazz standard features the 9th chord in A# (D shape) in its chord progression, adding a romantic and melancholic feel to the music.
   
2. "Rock With You" by Michael Jackson - In this disco-pop hit, the 9th chord in A# (D shape) is used to create groove and sophistication in the harmony, contributing to the infectious and danceable vibe of the song.

3. "Don't You Worry 'Bout A Thing" by Stevie Wonder - Stevie Wonder incorporates the 9th chord in A# (D shape) in this funky and soulful track, enhancing the jazzy and uplifting mood of the song.
